meanings.definition: The action of attacking or persecuting in a group.
meanings.sent1: The mobbing of the new student by a group of bullies was cruel.
meanings.sent2: The mobbing of the innocent victim by a gang was reported to the authorities.
meanings.sent3: The mobbing of the cat by a flock of birds was quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: The mobbing of the suspect by reporters was intense.
meanings.sent5: The mobbing of the tree by monkeys was a noisy affair.

meanings.definition: A group of people who attack or persecute someone.
meanings.sent1: The angry mobbing of the shoplifter shocked the onlookers.
meanings.sent2: The aggressive mobbing of the politician by protestors caused chaos.
meanings.sent3: The playful mobbing of the dog by children made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The relentless mobbing of the celebrity by fans was overwhelming.
meanings.sent5: The sudden mobbing of the picnic area by seagulls startled the visitors.

meanings.definition: To attack or persecute in a group.
meanings.sent1: The bullies decided to start mobbing the weaker kids at school.
meanings.sent2: The protestors planned to mob the government building to demand change.
meanings.sent3: The birds began to mob the scarecrow in the field for fun.
meanings.sent4: The reporters tried to mob the celebrity for exclusive interviews.
meanings.sent5: The monkeys would mob any intruders in their territory to protect their group.
